intro: Rheedia chocoensis, commonly known as the Chocoan rheedia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its erect stem, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Rheedia chocoensis is often found in shaded, humid environments and thrives in nutrient-rich soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
